channel.title: P Hats and Duplicating
channel.description:
Ok, so here we go with the report I promised earlier on 2 different threads (Halloween...ugly and I don't remember what, because it was several days ago). So, here we go: /\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\ The Basic Story \/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/ When party hats were first came to the RuneScape world, they were very commonly found and had no store value. Actully, they were so common that players would sell them to the general stores for absolutely no profit. Later, some players decided to increase the rarity of party hats by collecting them and storing them away in their bank accounts. These players would go around buying every party hat in sight. Because of the low value of party hats, they collected so many that the hats started to disappear. This seriously affected the RuneScape economy. At first, players were giving up expensive pieces of armor for these worthless, paper hats. Yet, after seeing how the prices were jumping, players decided to hold on to their hats and refused to sell them, which increased the value even more. Soon, these worthless hats became treasured collectors items that sold for millions upon millions of gold pieces.
On the night of November 6, 2003, there were several rumors going around that RuneScape items could now be duplicated. Not much later, a record amount of party hat owners and sellers show up in world one market and begin to sell them for very cheap prices. Near the end of the day, several merchants were selling full inventories of pink party hats for nearly three fourths of the price. Fellow RuneScape players become suspicious.
On November 7, 2003, Jagex has announced that a major bug has been discovered and that several RuneScape players were duplicating items, mainly party hats and Christmas crackers. These duplications are against the RuneScape rules but even more importantly; it highly effected the RuneScape economy. Prices dropped dramatically and several players have quit the game because of high money losses. Jagex announces that they will reward the first person to report how the bug works a free lifetime membership. Within a couple hours, Jagex receives over 600 messages and they quickly shut down all the RuneScape servers at approximately 10:45 A.M. (United States Central time). The bug is quickly fixed yet no actions have been taken against the duplicators and duplications. Jagex also announces that they are trying their best to take care of the unfair wealth and cheaters. They advise their fellow RuneScape players to neither buy nor sell any party hats and to drop any party hats you currently own in which you believe could be a duplication.
Unsurprisingly, RuneScape players don't listen to a word that Jagex says. That very night, numerous low level characters stand around world 1 market trying to purchase and sell party hats at very low prices. The RuneScape economy seems doomed because of the tragic money losses. Very few actually understand what this bug was and how it worked. It is still unknown as to what actions Jagex will take against these duplications and tragic money losses. Majority of the on-going rumors say that the duplicates will be easy to spot and delete from the Jagex database. Other rumors say that party hats will finally be un- tradable to control all the unfair wealth and greed.
/\/\/\/\/\/\ Weeks later \/\/\/\/\/\/
Still not everything has been taken care of. The Christmas cracker duplicates have been deleted but duplicated party hats are still among us and the prices are still at an all time low. Rumors of party hats being dropped again were going around yet it was not true. Unfortunately, this seems like the end of the duplication issue. Party hats are everywhere and the prices are low yet still rising.
/\/\/\/\/\/\ Months later \/\/\/\/\/\/
A final update. The results are finally verified. Yes, the few players that understood the duplication bug were in fact banned. The bug was fixed, duplicated Christmas crackers were deleted, but party hat duplications are still around. Party hat prices are finally rising very slowly and will eventually pass the recent peaks. There are no more worries about value drops. The whole ordeal is over. *~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~* /\/\/\/\/\/\/\ "Future Drops" \/\/\/\/\/\/\/
Many rumors about future drops have been going around. Some say that Jagex has put a stop to holiday items because of the "unfair wealth" that they have caused. Yet, if Jagex does continue holiday item drops, the rules that were placed upon bunny ears and scythes will affect all future holiday drops.
Yet, after 2 holiday item cancellations, it seems as if this is the end of all the holiday drops. Certain events might take place during holidays in the new RuneScape but never in the classic version.
Hope you enjoyed this report :D

item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Such a shitty liar.

ROFL! seriously theres no need to lie, its pretty obvious that you are. but i remember when i first started playing, the most expensive party hat was only like 8m. and santas were going for 300-350k. i had 3 santas and 2 green masks at this time, then sold them and quit runescape for 3 months and when i came back all the rares had rose so much. it blowed cause if i didnt sell them i woulda been so rich in RS
